Joel-1-1: Locusts Will Destroy the Crops 1 Joel son of Pethuel received this message from the Lord:
Joel-1-2: 2 Leaders, listen to this message!     Listen to me, all you people who live in the land. Listen to me, all you people who live in the land. Has anything like this ever happened in your life?     Did anything like this happen during your fathers’ lifetime? Did anything like this happen during your fathers’ lifetime?
Joel-1-3: 3 You will tell these things to your children,     and your children will tell their children, and your children will tell their children,     and your grandchildren will tell the people of the next generation. and your grandchildren will tell the people of the next generation.
Joel-1-4: 4 What the cutting locust[a] has left,     the swarming locust has eaten. the swarming locust has eaten. And what the swarming locust has left,     the hopping locust has eaten. the hopping locust has eaten. And what the hopping locust has left,     the destroying locust has eaten! the destroying locust has eaten!
Joel-1-5: The Locusts—A Powerful Army 5 Drunks, wake up and cry!     All of you who drink wine, cry All of you who drink wine, cry because your sweet wine is finished.     You will not taste it again. You will not taste it again.
Joel-1-6: 6 A powerful nation came to attack my land.     Its soldiers were too many to count. Its soldiers were too many to count. Its weapons were as sharp as a lion’s teeth     and as powerful as a lion’s jaw. and as powerful as a lion’s jaw.
Joel-1-7: 7 It destroyed my grapevine.     Its good vines withered and died. Its good vines withered and died. It destroyed my fig tree,     stripped off the bark and threw it away. stripped off the bark and threw it away.
Joel-1-8: The People Cry 8 Cry like a young woman crying     because the man she was ready to marry has died. because the man she was ready to marry has died.
Joel-1-9: 9 Priests, servants of the Lord, cry     because there will be no more grain and drink offerings in the Lord’s Temple. because there will be no more grain and drink offerings in the Lord’s Temple.
Joel-1-10: 10 The fields are ruined.     Even the ground is crying Even the ground is crying     because the grain is destroyed; because the grain is destroyed; the new wine is dried up,     and the olive oil is gone. and the olive oil is gone.
Joel-1-11: 11 Be sad, farmers!     Cry loudly for the grapes, Cry loudly for the grapes, for the wheat, and for the barley,     because the harvest in the field is ruined. because the harvest in the field is ruined.
Joel-1-12: 12 The vines have become dry,     and the fig tree is dying. and the fig tree is dying. All the trees in the field—     the pomegranate, the palm, and the apple—have withered. the pomegranate, the palm, and the apple—have withered.     And happiness among the people has died. And happiness among the people has died.
Joel-1-13: 13 Priests, put on sackcloth and cry loudly.     Servants of the altar, cry loudly. Servants of the altar, cry loudly. Servants of my God, you will sleep in sackcloth,     because there will be no more grain and drink offerings in God’s Temple. because there will be no more grain and drink offerings in God’s Temple.
Joel-1-14: The Terrible Destruction of the Locusts 14 Tell the people that there will be a special time of fasting. Call them together for a special meeting. Bring the leaders and everyone living in the land together at the Temple of the Lord your God, and pray to the Lord.
Joel-1-15: 15 Be sad because the Lord’s special day is near. At that time punishment will come like an attack from God All-Powerful.
Joel-1-16: 16 Our food is gone. Joy and happiness are gone from the Temple of our God.
Joel-1-17: 17 We planted seeds, but the seeds became dry and dead lying in the soil. Our plants are dry and dead. Our barns are empty and falling down.
Joel-1-18: 18 The animals are hungry and groaning. The herds of cattle wander around confused because they have no grass to eat. The sheep are dying.[b]
Joel-1-19: 19 Lord, I am calling to you for help. Fire has changed our green fields into a desert. Flames have burned all the trees in the field.
Joel-1-20: 20 Wild animals also need your help. The streams are dry—there is no water! Fire has changed our green fields into a desert.
Joel-2-1: The Coming Day of the Lord 2 Blow the trumpet on Zion. 2 Blow the trumpet on Zion.     Shout a warning on my holy mountain. Shout a warning on my holy mountain. Let all the people who live in the land shake with fear.     The Lord’s special day is coming; The Lord’s special day is coming;     it is near. it is near.
Joel-2-2: 2 It will be a dark, gloomy day.     It will be a dark and cloudy day. It will be a dark and cloudy day. At sunrise you will see the army spread over the mountains.     It will be a great and powerful army. It will be a great and powerful army. There has never been anything like it before,     and there will never be anything like it again. and there will never be anything like it again.
Joel-2-3: 3 The army will destroy the land like a burning fire.     In front of them the land will be like the Garden of Eden. In front of them the land will be like the Garden of Eden. Behind them the land will be like an empty desert.     Nothing will escape them. Nothing will escape them.
Joel-2-4: 4 They look like horses.     They run like war horses. They run like war horses.
Joel-2-5: 5 Listen to them. It is like the noise of chariots     riding over the mountains. riding over the mountains. It is like the noise of flames     burning the chaff. burning the chaff. They are a powerful people,     who are ready for war. who are ready for war.
Joel-2-6: 6 Before this army, people shake with fear.     Their faces become pale from fear. Their faces become pale from fear.
Joel-2-7: 7 The soldiers run fast.     They climb over the walls. They climb over the walls. Each soldier marches straight ahead.     They don’t move from their path. They don’t move from their path.
Joel-2-8: 8 They don’t trip each other.     Each soldier walks in his own path. Each soldier walks in his own path. If one of the soldiers is hit and falls down,     the others keep right on marching. the others keep right on marching.
Joel-2-9: 9 They run to the city.     They quickly climb over the wall. They quickly climb over the wall. They climb into the houses.     They climb through the windows like thieves. They climb through the windows like thieves.
Joel-2-10: 10 Before them, earth and sky shake.     The sun and the moon become dark, and the stars stop shining. The sun and the moon become dark, and the stars stop shining.
Joel-2-11: 11 The Lord calls loudly to his army.     His camp is very large. His camp is very large. The army obeys his commands.     His army is very powerful. His army is very powerful. The Lord’s special day is a great and terrible day.     No one can stop it. No one can stop it.
Joel-2-12: The Lord Tells the People to Change 12 This is the Lord’s message:     “Now come back to me with all your heart. “Now come back to me with all your heart. Cry and mourn, and don’t eat anything!     Show that you are sad for doing wrong. Show that you are sad for doing wrong.
Joel-2-13: 13 Tear your hearts,     not your clothes.[a]” not your clothes.[a]” Come back to the Lord your God.     He is kind and merciful. He is kind and merciful. He does not become angry quickly.     He has great love. He has great love. Maybe he will change his mind     about the bad punishment he planned. about the bad punishment he planned.
Joel-2-14: 14 Who knows, maybe he will change his mind     and leave behind a blessing for you. and leave behind a blessing for you. Then you can give grain and drink offerings     to the Lord your God. to the Lord your God.
Joel-2-15: Pray to the Lord 15 Blow the trumpet at Zion.     Call for a special meeting. Call for a special meeting.     Call for a special time of fasting. Call for a special time of fasting.
Joel-2-16: 16 Bring the people together.     Call for a special meeting. Call for a special meeting. Bring together the old men,     the children, and the small babies still at their mothers’ breasts. the children, and the small babies still at their mothers’ breasts. Let the bride and her new husband     come from their bedroom. come from their bedroom.
Joel-2-17: 17 Let the priests, the Lord’s servants,     cry between the porch[b] and the altar. cry between the porch[b] and the altar. All of them should say this: “Lord, have mercy on your people.     Don’t let your people be put to shame. Don’t let your people be put to shame.     Don’t let other people tell jokes about your people. Don’t let other people tell jokes about your people. Don’t let the other nations laugh at us and say,     ‘Where is their God?’” ‘Where is their God?’”
Joel-2-18: The Lord Will Restore the Land 18 Then the Lord cared very much about his land.     He felt sorry for his people. He felt sorry for his people.
Joel-2-19: 19 The Lord spoke to his people. He said, “I will send you grain, wine, and oil.     You will have plenty. You will have plenty.     I will not shame you among the nations anymore. I will not shame you among the nations anymore.
Joel-2-20: 20 No, I will force the people from the north[c] to leave your land     and make them go into a dry, empty land. and make them go into a dry, empty land. Some of them will go to the eastern sea     and some to the western sea. and some to the western sea. They did such terrible things,     but they will be like a dead and rotting body. but they will be like a dead and rotting body. There will be such a terrible smell!”
Joel-2-21: The Land Will Be Made New Again 21 Land, don’t be afraid.     Be happy and full of joy. Be happy and full of joy.     The Lord will do great things. The Lord will do great things.
Joel-2-22: 22 Animals of the field, don’t be afraid.     The desert pastures will grow grass. The desert pastures will grow grass. The trees will grow fruit.     The fig trees and the vines will grow plenty of fruit. The fig trees and the vines will grow plenty of fruit.
Joel-2-23: 23 So be happy, people of Zion.     Be joyful in the Lord your God. Be joyful in the Lord your God. He is good and will give you rain.     He will send the early rains and the late rains as before. He will send the early rains and the late rains as before.
Joel-2-24: 24 The threshing floors will be filled with wheat,     and the barrels will overflow with wine and olive oil. and the barrels will overflow with wine and olive oil.
Joel-2-25: 25 “I, the Lord, sent my army against you.     The swarming locusts and the hopping locusts The swarming locusts and the hopping locusts     and the destroying locusts and the cutting locusts[d] ate everything you had. and the destroying locusts and the cutting locusts[d] ate everything you had. But I will pay you back     for those years of trouble. for those years of trouble.
Joel-2-26: 26 Then you will have plenty to eat.     You will be full. You will be full. You will praise the name of the Lord your God.     He has done wonderful things for you. He has done wonderful things for you. My people will never again be ashamed.
Joel-2-27: 27 You will know that I am with Israel.     You will know that I am the Lord your God. You will know that I am the Lord your God.     There is no other God. There is no other God. My people will never be ashamed again.”
Joel-2-28: God Will Give His Spirit to All People 28 “After this,     I will pour out my Spirit on all kinds of people. I will pour out my Spirit on all kinds of people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy,     your old men will have dreams, your old men will have dreams,     and your young men will see visions. and your young men will see visions.
Joel-2-29: 29 In those days I will pour out my Spirit     even on servants, both men and women. even on servants, both men and women.
Joel-2-30: 30 I will work wonders in the sky and on the earth.     There will be blood, fire, and thick smoke. There will be blood, fire, and thick smoke.
Joel-2-31: 31 The sun will be changed into darkness,     and the moon will be as red as blood. and the moon will be as red as blood.     Then the great and fearful day of the Lord will come! Then the great and fearful day of the Lord will come!
Joel-2-32: 32 And everyone who trusts in the Lord[e] will be saved.     There will be survivors on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, There will be survivors on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem,     just as the Lord said. just as the Lord said. Yes, those left alive will be the ones     the Lord has called. the Lord has called.
Joel-3-1: Judah’s Enemies Will Be Punished 3 “Yes, at that time I will bring back the people of Judah and Jerusalem from captivity.
Joel-3-2: 2 I will also gather all the nations together. I will bring all these nations down into Jehoshaphat Valley.[a] There I will judge them. Those nations scattered my people, Israel. They forced them to live in other nations, so I will punish those nations. They divided up my land.
Joel-3-3: 3 They threw lots for my people. They sold boys to buy a prostitute, and they sold girls to buy wine to drink.
Joel-3-4: 4 “Tyre! Sidon! All of you areas of Philistia! You are not important to me![b] Are you punishing me for something I did? You might think that you are punishing me, but I will soon punish you.
Joel-3-5: 5 You took my silver and gold. You took my precious treasures and put them in your temples.[c]
Joel-3-6: 6 “You sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks. That way you could take them far from their land.
Joel-3-7: 7 You sent my people to that faraway place, but I will bring them back. And I will punish you for what you did.
Joel-3-8: 8 I will sell your sons and daughters to the people of Judah. Then they will sell them to the faraway Sabeans.[d]” This is what the Lord said.
Joel-3-9: Prepare for War 9 Announce this among the nations:     Prepare for war! Prepare for war! Wake up the strong men!     Let all the men of war come near. Let all the men of war come near.     Let them come up! Let them come up!
Joel-3-10: 10 Beat your plows into swords.     Make spears from your pruning hooks.[e] Make spears from your pruning hooks.[e] Let the weak man say,     “I am a strong soldier.” “I am a strong soldier.”
Joel-3-11: 11 All you nations, hurry!     Come together in that place. Come together in that place.     Lord, bring your strong soldiers. Lord, bring your strong soldiers.
Joel-3-12: 12 Wake up, nations!     Come to Jehoshaphat Valley. Come to Jehoshaphat Valley. There I will sit to judge     all the surrounding nations. all the surrounding nations.
Joel-3-13: 13 Bring the sickle,     because the harvest is ripe.[f] because the harvest is ripe.[f] Come, walk on the grapes,     because the winepress is full. because the winepress is full. The barrels will be full and spilling over,     because their evil is great. because their evil is great.
Joel-3-14: 14 There are many, many people in the Valley of Decision.[g]     The Lord’s special day is near in the Valley of Decision. The Lord’s special day is near in the Valley of Decision.
Joel-3-15: 15 The sun and the moon will become dark.     The stars will stop shining. The stars will stop shining.
Joel-3-16: 16 The Lord God will shout from Zion. He will shout from Jerusalem,     and the sky and the earth will shake. and the sky and the earth will shake. But the Lord God will be a safe place for his people.     He will be a place of safety for the people of Israel. He will be a place of safety for the people of Israel.
Joel-3-17: 17 “Then you will know that I am the Lord your God.     I live on Zion, my holy mountain. I live on Zion, my holy mountain. Jerusalem will become holy.     Strangers will never pass through that city again. Strangers will never pass through that city again.
Joel-3-18: A New Life for Judah Promised 18 “On that day the mountains will drip with sweet wine.     The hills will flow with milk, The hills will flow with milk,     and water will flow through all the empty rivers of Judah. and water will flow through all the empty rivers of Judah. A fountain will come from the Lord’s Temple.     It will give water to Acacia Valley. It will give water to Acacia Valley.
Joel-3-19: 19 Egypt will be empty.     Edom will be an empty wilderness, Edom will be an empty wilderness, because they were cruel to the people of Judah.     They killed innocent people[h] in their country. They killed innocent people[h] in their country.
Joel-3-20: 20 But there will always be people living in Judah.     People will live in Jerusalem through many generations. People will live in Jerusalem through many generations.
Joel-3-21: 21 Those people killed my people,     so I really will punish them!” so I really will punish them!” The Lord God will live in Zion!
